physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Triceps insufficiency was evident. The patient could actively flex the elbow to 135°; however, he was unable to extend it against gravity, although passive extension was possible to 20°. Radiographs showed 22° of valgus angulation of the ulnar component. The patient was asymptomatic.

Presented with a one-month history of elbow pain, decreased range of motion, and considerable swelling over the olecranon. No ulnar nerve dysfunction noted. Radiographs confirmed the axle assembly had come apart due to a fracture of the tongs on the inner pin and that the fragmented hinge assembly was within the olecranon bursa.
The triceps was intact and the wound had healed. The active range of motion of the elbow was from 0° to 130°, and forearm rotation was full. Radiographs showed unremarkable findings.

Extension power at the elbow was documented as 4/5, with the active range of flexion from 5° of hyperextension to 135°. Pronation was to 75°, and supination was to 55°. In maximal extension, free play of the elbow was from 5° to 20° of valgus. Radiographs demonstrated secure fixation of the implants and 6° of valgus alignment.
